'''Greta Thunberg''' (born 3 January 2003) is a [[Swedes|Swedish]] climate activist. She is known for her strike outside the [[Riksdag]] in [[Stockholm]], [[Sweden]] under the slogan ''Skolstrejk för klimatet'' (''School Strike for the climate'').<ref name="Guardian1">{{Cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/science/2018/sep/01/swedish-15-year-old-cutting-class-to-fight-the-climate-crisis |title=The Swedish 15-year-old who's cutting class to fight the climate crisis |date=1 September 2018 |work=The Guardian}}</ref>
== Life == Greta Thunberg was born on 3 January 2003 to Swedish opera singer [[Malena Ernman]] and actor Svante Thunberg.
== Activism == Greta Thunberg studying ninth grade in a school in Stockholm. From 20 August 2018, she decided not to go to the school until the [[Swedish general election, 2018|Swedish general election]] which was held on 9 September 2018. She made the decision after her country faced the unprecedented [[2018 European heat wave|heatwaves]] and [[2018 Sweden wildfires|wildfires]] during the summer.<ref name="Guardian1"/> She demanding the Sweden government to reduce the carbon emissions as stated in the [[Paris agreement]] on [[climate change]]. She sat outside the Swedish parliament everyday during the school hours with the slogan ''school strike for the climate'' and after the election she is protesting on every Friday.<ref name="Newyorker1" /> In Twitter, she uses hashtags #Klimatstrejka, #ClimateStrike and #FridaysforFuture which are featured in media around the world. She participated in Rise for Climate demonstration outside the [[European Parliament]] in [[Brussels]] and the Declaration of Rebellion organized by [[Extinction Rebellion]] in [[London]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.commondreams.org/news/2018/10/31/our-darkest-hour-declaration-rebellion-new-group-vows-mass-civil-disobedience-save |title=This Is Our Darkest Hour: With Declaration of Rebellion, New Group Vows Mass Civil Disobedience to Save Planet |date=31 October 2018 |work=Common Dreams}}</ref> Her Friday strike got the world wide attention. Similar kind of protests organized in other countries like Holland, Germany, Finland, Denmark and Australia.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.expressen.se/nyheter/klimat/klimatmanifestation-over-hela-landet-odesfraga/ |title=Klimatmanifestation över hela landet: ”Ödesfråga” |date=30 November 2018 |work=[[Expressen]]}}</ref>
In Australia, thousands of school students who inspired by Greta went on stirke on Fridays by ignoring the call of their Prime minister [[Scott Morrison]] who told in the parliament that "what we want is more learning in schools and less activism".<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://edition-m.cnn.com/2018/11/30/australia/australia-school-climate-strike-scli-intl/index.html?r=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.co.in%2Fsearch%3Fq%3Dclimate%2Bstrike%2BAustralia%26client%3Ducweb-b%26channel%3Dsb |title=Australian school children defy prime minister with climate strike |date=30 November 2018 |work=CNN}}</ref>
